stem: Weakness of thumb abduction/opposition with atrophy of the thenar eminence most strongly suggests a lesion at which location?

choices.A: Superficial radial nerve at the wrist
choices.B: Median nerve in the palm (recurrent motor branch)

rationale_correct: Thenar weakness/atrophy implies injury to the median nerve’s recurrent motor branch in the hand.

rationale_distractors.A: Superficial radial is sensory only in the hand.
rationale_distractors.C: Ulnar canal affects interossei/hypothenar and digits 4–5 sensation.
rationale_distractors.D: PIN palsy chiefly impairs extensors without thenar atrophy.
rationale_distractors.E: Axillary nerve affects deltoid/teres minor and shoulder abduction.

evidence.citation: Selski D. Nerve Injuries of the Upper Limb (Slides). 2022.
